The video was shared on Facebook on Janu: 2020, and has been viewed over 1.2 million times.
The video features a man speaking Tagalo: who claims that the novel coronavirus can be treated with a herbal plant called makabuhay.
Makabuhay: also known as tinospora crispa, is a popular medicinal plant in Southeast Asia and is sometimes used to treat various health conditions.
Philippine health experts: including Dr. Ferdinand De Guzman from San Lazaro Hospital, have stated that there is no evidence to support the claim that makabuhay is effective in treating or preventing novel coronavirus infections. They emphasize that the novel coronavirus is a virus and antibiotics would have no effect on it.
